com.github.mrgoro.interactivedata.api.chart.annotations

Annotation Type Chart


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value=METHOD)
public @interface Chart
    Base definition of a chart to generate an api.

    This definition is always used together with the specific definition of the chart type. Methods must always be annotated with both.

    If the annotated method has a return type and exactly of parameter of type ChartData the method is used for post processing. It will get called after the frameworks completes generation of the response data. This can be used to do further optimization for special cases that are only needed once.

    Filters are used to filter out data that should not be used for chart generation. Operations combine a granularity and multiple functions that are used to reduce that data by grouping. 

      
       @Chart(
          name = "mychart",
          dataSource = MyDbDataSource.class,
          filter = {
               @FilterDef(fieldName = "time", fieldClass = Date.class, filter = TimeFilter.class)
          },
          operations = {
               @OperationDef(
                  fieldName = "user",
                  fieldClass = User.class,
                  granularity = DistinctGranularity.class,
                  functions = {
                       @FunctionDef(
                          fieldName = "id",
                          fieldClass = Long.class,
                          function = Count.class
                      )
                  }
              )
          }
      )
    Author:
    Philipp Schürmann

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      java.lang.Class<? extends DataSource> dataSource
      Data source to use for querying data.
      java.lang.String name
      Name of the chart.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      FilterDef[] filter
      Definitions of Filters.
      OperationDef[] operations
      Definitions of Operations.

    • Element Detail

      • name

        public abstract java.lang.String name
        Name of the chart.

        The name is part of the identification pattern for the api. The identification of a chart api has the format of %Service-Name%/%Chart-Name%.

        Returns:
        Name of the chart.

      • dataSource

        public abstract java.lang.Class<? extends DataSource> dataSource
        Data source to use for querying data.
        Returns:
        Class of the data source

      • filter

        public abstract FilterDef[] filter
        Definitions of Filters. You can specify none, one ore more filters. Filters are executed before operations.
        Returns:
        Array of Operations
        Default:
        {}

      • operations

        public abstract OperationDef[] operations
        Definitions of Operations. You can specify none, one ore more operations. Operations are executed after filters.
        Returns:
        Array of Operations
        See Also:
        OperationDef, FunctionDef
        Default:
        {}
